```{r}
#LISTS: R list is the object which contains elements of different types â€“ like strings, numbers, vectors and another list inside it. R list can also contain a matrix or a function as its elements. The list is created using the list() function in R. In other words, a list is a generic vector containing other objects.
var<-c(1,2,3)
char_vec<-c("Hadoop","Spark","Flink","Mahout")
logic_vec<-c(TRUE,FALSE,TRUE,FALSE)
out<-c(var,char_vec,logic_vec)
out
out_list<-list(var, char_vec, logic_vec)
out_list

list_data <- list("Red", "White", c(1,2,3), TRUE, 22.4)
print(list_data)

data_list<-list(c("Jan","Feb","Mar"),matrix(c(1,2,3,4,-1,9),nrow=2),list("Red"))

names(data_list) <- c("Monat", "Matrix", "Misc")
print(data_list)


#operations in lists
var[1]+var[2]


list_data[1]<-"Pink"
print(list_data)

#coversion of list into vector
int_list<-list(1:5)
print(int_list)
vec1<-unlist(int_list)
print(vec1)

#R predefined lists
letters
LETTERS
month.abb
month.name
```
